thread.title: Trio of UK recruits to receive Army All-American jerseys
thread.title_full: Trio of UK recruits to receive Army All-American jerseys

title: Trio of UK recruits to receive Army All-American jerseys
text:
Trio of UK recruits to receive Army All-American jerseys Updated: Tue 3:23 PM, Oct 20, 2015 / Headlines List / Article 
LEXINGTON, Ky. (WKYT) â€“ UK recruits Kash Daniel, Drake Jackson and Landon Young will soon receive Army All-American jerseys, signifying their selection as participants in the annual U.S. Army All-American Bowl. 
Jackson is schedule to receive a jersey this Friday, while Young will be presented his jersey Oct. 23. 
Jackson, a 6-foot2, 288-lb offensive guard from Woodford Co., chose the Wildcats over Ohio State and Alabama. 
Young is a 6-foot-7, 270-lb offensive tackle out of Lafayette High School. Young chose UK over several schools, including Ohio State and Alabama. Young will receive his jersey in a ceremony at Lafayette on Oct. 26. 
Daniel will also be an Army All-American. The 6-foot-2, 235-lb linebacker also plays quarterback at Paintsville High School. Daniel's jersey ceremony is on Oct. 27.
